title: Bumble typeface
content:
Im trying to find a similar typeface to this but the closest Ive come is Cezanne wich isnt very close at all. Anyone who has suggestions?

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [bumble.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20070307165002/http:/typophile.com/files/bumble.jpg) | 95.31 KB |
author: plojel

comments.content:
Try also these for a similar feeling:

[Lassigue D’Mato](http://web.archive.org/web/20070307165002/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/lassigue-dmato/)  
 [Gizmo](http://web.archive.org/web/20070307165002/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=GTT0000006) by Nick Cooke :^)  
 [Deadman](http://web.archive.org/web/20070307165002/http:/www.volcano-type.de/index.html?page=family.html)  
 [Feltrinelli](http://web.archive.org/web/20070307165002/http:/www.t26.com/fonts/display.php?f_id=203)  
 [Missiva](http://web.archive.org/web/20070307165002/http:/www.dstype.com/)  
 [Baker Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20070307165002/http:/www.itcfonts.com/fonts/detail.htm?pid=401491&AID=5529319)  
 [La Danse](http://web.archive.org/web/20070307165002/http:/www.p22.com/ihof/font.asp?font=ladanse&face=ladanse)

and others …

PS: You are aware that this [is handdrawn](http://web.archive.org/web/20070307165002/http:/typophile.com/node/20863), aren’t you, Petter?

Renko’s suggestions are good ones, and you might also consider some of the new OpenType fonts that have a lot of alternate characters and contextual variations. [Dear Sarah](http://web.archive.org/web/20070307165002/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000104), from Veer is a more contemporary-looking handwriting style, and [Secret Scrypt Pro](http://web.archive.org/web/20070307165002/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/ScriptSmall6/SecretScryptPro.gif), from Canada Type, is more antique-looking.

- Mike Yanega
Great! Thank you for your help. Yes Renko, Im aware, every bottle is different :) Can any of you recall any two-word logos with the combination of a grotesk font and a script font?
